titles.title: To authorize the presentation of a gold medal on behalf of the Congress to the next of kin or other personal representative of Justin W. Dart, Jr., on behalf of the entire disability community and in recognition of his many contributions to the Nation throughout his lifetime, especially his tireless work to secure passage of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Domestic Monetary Policy, Technology and Economic Growth.

committee.subcommittee: Domestic Monetary Policy, Technology, and Economic Growth
committee.name: House Financial Services

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 7/23/2002--Introduced. Authorizes the presentation on behalf of Congress of a congressional gold medal to the next of kin or other personal representative of Justin W. Dart, Jr., in recognition of his many contributions to the Nation throughout his lifetime and as one of the true champions of the rights of individuals with disabilities, especially his tireless work to secure passage of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.
